tour_title: Hanoi Old Quarter & Hidden Gems Food Tour
tour_description: Dive deep into the culinary heart of Hanoi. This walking tour takes you through the maze of the Old Quarter, sampling famous dishes like Bun Cha and Egg Coffee, while learning about the city's thousand-year history from a local perspective.

itinerary.title: Meet at St. Joseph's Cathedral
itinerary.location: 40 Nha Chung, Hang Trong, Hoan Kiem
itinerary.description: Gathering point and brief introduction to the French colonial architecture.

itinerary.title: Pho Breakfast
itinerary.description: Start the day with Hanoi's most famous noodle soup at a legendary local spot.

itinerary.title: Old Quarter Alley Walk
itinerary.description: Navigate narrow alleys, see local life, and visit a hidden communal temple.

itinerary.title: Banh Mi Tasting
itinerary.description: Try a modern twist on the classic Vietnamese sandwich.

itinerary.title: Dong Xuan Market Visit
itinerary.description: Explore the bustling wholesale market and sample local dried fruits.

itinerary.title: Bun Cha Lunch (Obama's Spot)
itinerary.description: Enjoy grilled pork and noodles at the famous restaurant visited by Anthony Bourdain.

itinerary.title: Famous Egg Coffee
itinerary.description: End the tour with the unique creamy egg coffee invented in Hanoi.

tour_title: Classic Ha Long Bay Day Cruise
tour_description: Experience the UNESCO World Heritage site of Ha Long Bay on a traditional junk boat. Cruise past thousands of limestone islands, visit spectacular caves, and enjoy kayaking in emerald waters.

itinerary.title: Hotel Pickup & Transfer
itinerary.description: Drive via the new expressway from Hanoi to Tuan Chau Marina.

itinerary.title: Boarding & Welcome Drink
itinerary.description: Check-in on the boat and safety briefing while cruising out.

itinerary.title: Seafood Lunch on Board
itinerary.description: Enjoy a multi-course Vietnamese seafood lunch while passing iconic islets.

itinerary.title: Explore Sung Sot (Surprise) Cave
itinerary.description: Trek up to the largest and most magnificent cave in the bay.

itinerary.title: Kayaking at Luon Cave
itinerary.description: Kayak or take a bamboo boat through a water cave into a hidden lagoon.

itinerary.title: Ti Top Island Sunset View
itinerary.description: Climb 400 steps for panoramic views of the bay or swim at the beach.

itinerary.title: Return Cruise & Sunset Party
itinerary.description: Enjoy tea and fruits on the sundeck while sailing back to shore.

tour_title: Hoi An Ancient Town: Lanterns & History
tour_description: Step back in time in the charming yellow streets of Hoi An. This walking tour covers historical houses, the iconic Japanese Bridge, and ends with a magical boat ride surrounded by colorful lanterns on the Thu Bon River.

itinerary.title: Ticket Office Meeting
itinerary.location: Hoi An Ticket Booth, Hoang Dieu St.
itinerary.description: Purchase entrance tickets and begin walking tour.

itinerary.title: Japanese Covered Bridge
itinerary.description: Visit the iconic symbol of Hoi An built in the 16th century.

itinerary.title: Tan Ky Old House
itinerary.description: Tour a 200-year-old merchant house combining Japanese, Chinese, and Vietnamese influences.

itinerary.title: Phuc Kien Assembly Hall
itinerary.description: Visit the ornate Chinese assembly hall dedicated to the sea goddess.

itinerary.title: Dinner - Local Specialties
itinerary.description: Try Cao Lau noodles and White Rose dumplings.

itinerary.title: Lantern Boat Ride
itinerary.location: Thu Bon River Bach Dang Wharf
itinerary.description: Take a small sampan boat on the river and release a paper lantern for good luck.

itinerary.title: Night Market Free Time
itinerary.description: Explore the bustling night market across the bridge for souvenirs.

tour_description: An intense and educational look into the Vietnam War (American War) history in Ho Chi Minh City. Visit key historical sites to understand the conflict's impact on the city and country.

itinerary.title: Hotel Pickup
itinerary.description: Pickup by private van and guide.

itinerary.title: War Remnants Museum
itinerary.description: Examine photographic exhibits and military equipment related to the Vietnam War. (Warning: Graphic content).

itinerary.title: Reunification Palace
itinerary.description: Tour the former presidential palace and see where the war officially ended in 1975.

itinerary.title: Local Vietnamese Lunch
itinerary.description: Lunch break in a beautiful colonial-style villa setting.

itinerary.title: Notre Dame Cathedral & Post Office
itinerary.description: Photo stop at these iconic French colonial landmarks nearby.

itinerary.title: CIA Building (Photo Stop)
itinerary.description: Quick look at the building famous for the rooftop helicopter evacuation photo.

tour_title: Mekong Delta: Ben Tre Coconut Kingdom
tour_description: Escape the city bustle to the watery world of the Mekong Delta. This tour focuses on Ben Tre province, known for its coconut jungles. Experience boat rides, local workshops, and rural life.

itinerary.title: Depart HCMC
itinerary.description: Drive southward out of the city towards the Delta region.

itinerary.title: Arrival at Hung Vuong Pier
itinerary.description: Board a larger motorized boat to cross the main river.

itinerary.title: Brick Kiln Visit
itinerary.description: See how traditional bricks are made by hand using local clay.

itinerary.title: Coconut Candy Workshop
itinerary.description: Watch the process of making coconut candy and sample warm candy right off the line.

itinerary.title: Tuk-Tuk Village Ride
itinerary.description: Ride a motorized cart through fruit orchards and quiet village roads.

itinerary.title: Elephant Ear Fish Lunch
itinerary.description: Enjoy special deep-fried fish wrapped in rice paper, a Delta specialty.

itinerary.title: Sampan Rowing Boat
itinerary.description: Switch to small hand-rowed sampans to navigate narrow palm-lined canals.

itinerary.title: Return Journey
itinerary.description: Drive back to Ho Chi Minh City, arriving around 5:30 PM.

tour_description: A full day of trekking through the stunning rice terraces of Sapa valley. Visit villages of the Black Hmong and Red Dao ethnic minorities, learn about their unique cultures, and witness breathtaking mountain scenery.

itinerary.title: Meet Guide & Start Trek
itinerary.description: Meet your local Hmong guide and begin walking down towards Muong Hoa valley.

itinerary.title: Y Linh Ho Village Viewpoint
itinerary.description: Trek along steep paths with panoramic views of terraced rice fields.

itinerary.title: Lao Chai Village (Black Hmong)
itinerary.description: Explore the village, observe daily life and traditional indigo dyeing techniques.

itinerary.title: Picnic Lunch by the River
itinerary.description: Simple picnic lunch provided by the guide near the Muong Hoa stream.

itinerary.title: Ta Van Village (Giay Minority)
itinerary.description: Continue trekking to Ta Van village, home to the Giay people, known for different architecture and customs.

itinerary.title: Pickup & Return
itinerary.description: Meet the van for transfer back up the mountain to Sapa town.

tour_description: Explore Vietnam's former capital and the seat of the Nguyen Dynasty. Visit the massive Imperial Citadel, the serene Thien Mu Pagoda, and the elaborate tombs of ancient Emperors.

itinerary.title: Pickup
itinerary.description: Pickup by car and guide.

itinerary.title: The Imperial Citadel
itinerary.description: Extensive walking tour of the Forbidden Purple City, royal palaces, and temples damaged during the war.

itinerary.title: Thien Mu Pagoda
itinerary.location: Ha Khe Hill, Perfume River bank
itinerary.description: Visit the tallest pagoda in Vietnam and symbol of Hue city.

itinerary.title: Royal Style Lunch
itinerary.description: Enjoy Hue cuisine, famous for its delicate presentation.

itinerary.title: Tomb of Emperor Tu Duc
itinerary.description: Visit the most poetic and expansive of the royal tombs, designed by the Emperor himself before his death.

itinerary.title: Incense Making Village
itinerary.description: Quick stop to see colorful displays of incense sticks and learn how they are made by hand.

tour_title: Da Nang Highlights: Bridges, Mountains & Beach
tour_description: Discover the modern coastal city of Da Nang. See the famous Dragon Bridge, explore the caves of the Marble Mountains, visit the giant Lady Buddha statue, and relax on My Khe beach.

itinerary.title: Marble Mountains
itinerary.description: Climb the stone steps to explore caves, pagodas, and viewpoints on the Water Mountain.

itinerary.title: Son Tra Peninsula & Lady Buddha
itinerary.description: Drive up the peninsula to see the tallest Lady Buddha statue in Vietnam and enjoy coastal views.

itinerary.title: Seafood Lunch Near Beach
itinerary.description: Fresh seafood lunch by the famous My Khe beach.

itinerary.title: Cham Sculpture Museum
itinerary.description: Learn about the ancient Champa kingdom that once ruled central Vietnam.

itinerary.title: Han Market Shopping
itinerary.description: Experience the busy local market selling everything from dried foods to clothes.

itinerary.title: Dragon Bridge Photo Stop
itinerary.description: Walk along the riverside to see the famous bridge shaped like a dragon before dropping off.

tour_title: Ninh Binh: Trang An & Mua Cave Adventure
tour_description: Known as 'Ha Long Bay on Land', Ninh Binh offers spectacular karst scenery. Take a sampan boat through caves at Trang An complex and hike up Mua Cave for an iconic viewpoint.

itinerary.title: Depart Hanoi
itinerary.description: Drive south from Hanoi to Ninh Binh province.

itinerary.title: Hoa Lu Ancient Capital
itinerary.description: Visit the temples dedicated to the Dinh and Le dynasties of 10th century Vietnam.

itinerary.title: Mua Cave Hike (Dragon Mountain)
itinerary.description: Challenge yourself with 500 steps to the top for the best panoramic view of the region.

itinerary.title: Local Goat Meat Lunch
itinerary.description: Lunch featuring local specialties, particularly mountain goat dishes.

itinerary.title: Trang An Boat Tour
itinerary.description: A relaxing 2.5-hour rowboat trip through a UNESCO landscape of rivers, caves, and temples (Skull Island filming location).

itinerary.title: Return to Hanoi
itinerary.description: Drive back to Hanoi, arriving early evening.

tour_title: Phu Quoc South Island Snorkeling & Sunset
tour_description: A relaxing day exploring the southern tip of Phu Quoc island. Visit a pearl farm, snorkel at coral reefs near smaller islets, relax on Sao Beach, and catch the sunset.

itinerary.title: Hotel Pickup
itinerary.description: Drive to the southern port of An Thoi.

itinerary.title: Board Speedboat
itinerary.description: Head out to the archipelago.

itinerary.title: Snorkeling at Gam Ghi Island
itinerary.description: Snorkel in clear waters to see coral and colorful fish.

itinerary.title: Lunch & Relax on May Rut Island
itinerary.description: BBQ seafood lunch on the island and free time to swim.

itinerary.title: Sao Beach Visit
itinerary.description: Relax on one of Phu Quoc's most famous white sand beaches.

itinerary.title: Sunset Sanato Beach Club (Optional stop)
itinerary.description: Famous spot for photos with art installations during sunset (entrance fee may be extra).
